clamdb 1.0.0
  • Reference

    Match Structures

    match_structures.Rd

    Match Structures

    match_structures(
  query_compounds,
  target_compound_structures,
  target_compound_aliases = NULL,
  match_var_order = c("inchikey", "inchikey_noproto", "inchikey_connectivity", "name"),
  target_primary_key = "systematicCompoundId",
  drop_ambiguous = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    query_compounds

    a tibble of compounds containing some combination of: name, inchi, inchikey, smiles.

    target_compound_structures

    a tibble of compounds containing a systematicCompoundId and some combination of: name, inchi, inchikey, smiles.

    target_compound_aliases

    an optional tibble containing additional aliases for a compound (1-many) with fields systematicCompoundId and alias.

    match_var_order

    a character vector of identifiers that will be sequentially searched for matches to a query_compound until a match is found.

    Options are

    • inchikey: exact match the full inchikey

    • inchikey_noproto: inchikey without the protonation layer (this field will be generated from the inchikey)

    • inchikey_connectivity: exact match to the structure layer of the inchikey (this field will be generated from the inchikey)

    • inchi: exact match to inchi

    • smiles: exact match to smiles

    • name: exact match to a compound's name

    • alias: exact match to a compound's aliases (from target_compound_aliases)

    target_primary_key

    variable in target_compound_structures and target_compound_aliases if provided which defines a unique compound.

    drop_ambiguous

    if drop_ambiguous is TRUE then an ambiguous match of one query to 2+ distinct compounds in systematic_compounds_con for a given variable in match_var_order will not be considered a match. If FALSE then multiple database matches may be returned for a given query.

    Value

    query_compounds with a systematicCompoundId column indicating which entry of target_compounds matches.

    Contents

    Developed by Sean Hackett, Phillip Seitzer.
